meanings.definition: To break or separate into parts or pieces
meanings.sent1: The old toy disintegrated into tiny bits.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the paper disintegrated into fragments.
meanings.sent3: The cake disintegrated into crumbs as soon as it was touched.
meanings.sent4: The sandcastle disintegrated like a fragile dream in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The ice sculpture disintegrated under the warm sun, melting away.

meanings.sent1: The fallen leaves disintegrated into the soil.
meanings.sent2: The fruit disintegrated quickly once it started to rot.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich disintegrated in the lunchbox, creating a foul smell.
meanings.sent4: The ancient parchment disintegrated into dust at the slightest touch.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house disintegrated over the years, returning to nature.

meanings.sent1: The old building disintegrated after the earthquake.
meanings.sent2: The cookie disintegrated in my hand as I tried to break it.
meanings.sent3: The sandcastle disintegrated under the weight of the waves.
meanings.sent4: The relationship disintegrated slowly, leaving only memories behind.
meanings.sent5: The fragile bridge disintegrated under the heavy load, collapsing into the river.
